title: 108_hr186
content: The Act titled "Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act of 2003" requires notification to consumers of food products produced on land where sewage sludge has been applied. The Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act is amended to require labeling of food produced on land where sewage sludge was applied, effective one year after the enactment of the Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act of 2003. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act of 2003 requires a sign to be posted near raw agricultural commodities or unlabeled food produced on land where sewage sludge was applied. Additionally, the Egg Products Inspection Act is amended to include provisions related to poultry raised on such land. The Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act of 2003 mandates labeling for eggs and egg products derived from poultry raised on land where sewage sludge was applied. The Federal Meat Inspection Act is also amended to address adulterated food. The Federal Meat Inspection Act is amended to include regulations regarding livestock that grazed on land where sewage sludge was applied, effective one year after the enactment of the Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act of 2003. The Federal Meat Inspection Act is amended to include regulations for labeling livestock that grazed on land where sewage sludge was applied or consumed feed from such land. A label or sign must notify consumers of this information. The Poultry Products Inspection Act is amended to include regulations for poultry derived from land where sewage sludge was applied. Effective one year after the Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act of 2003, poultry raised on such land must have sewage sludge application terminated at least one year before raising. The Poultry Products Inspection Act requires that poultry raised on land where sewage sludge was applied must have the application terminated at least one year before raising. Poultry products must be labeled or have a sign posted to inform consumers if they were raised on such land or consumed feed from it. The Poultry Products Inspection Act mandates that poultry raised on land where sewage sludge was applied must cease application one year before raising. This does not affect the prohibition on using sewage sludge in organic food production under the National Organic Program.
